title: Understanding Ka
text: The acid dissociation constant, Ka, is a measure of the strength of an acid in solution. It is specifically used for weak acids.

title: Reaction Representation
text: For a weak acid HA in water, the dissociation can be represented as: HA+H2O⇌H3O++A-.

title: Equilibrium Constant
text: The equilibrium constant expression for the dissociation of HA in water is given by: $$Ka=\frac{[H3*O+][A-]/[HA][H3*O+][A-]/[HA]}{[H3*O+][A-]/[HA]}$$.

hintAnswer: The equilibrium constant for the reaction HA+H2O⇌H3O++A-.
title: Identify the Correct Expression
text: Which of the following correctly describes the acid dissociation constant Ka for a weak acid HA in water?
choices: The rate at which HA dissolves in water.
The equilibrium constant for the reaction HA+H2O⇌H3O++A-.
The equilibrium constant for the reaction A-+H2O⇌HA+OH-.
